metadata.description: 94% baseline test questions - typical documentation queries

queries.query: How many requests per minute are allowed in the CloudFlow API?
queries.expected_answer: 100 requests per minute per authenticated user, 20 requests per minute for unauthenticated requests, with a burst allowance of 150 requests in a 10-second window

queries.query: What happens when I exceed the CloudFlow API rate limit?
queries.expected_answer: When you exceed the rate limit, you'll receive a `429 Too Many Requests` response with an error message indicating how long to wait before retrying

queries.query: How do I handle rate limit errors in my code?
queries.expected_answer: Implement exponential backoff, monitor `X-RateLimit-Remaining` header values, cache responses when appropriate, and consider upgrading to Enterprise tier for higher limits

queries.query: What are the CloudFlow API authentication methods?
queries.expected_answer: CloudFlow supports three authentication methods: API Keys, OAuth 2.0, and JWT Tokens

queries.query: How long do JWT tokens last in CloudFlow?
queries.expected_answer: All tokens expire after 3600 seconds (1 hour). Implement token refresh logic in your application.

queries.query: What should I do if my workflow exceeds the maximum execution timeout?
queries.expected_answer: Workflows have a default timeout of 3600 seconds (60 minutes). You can increase the timeout, optimize workflow steps, or split the workflow into smaller workflows

queries.query: How do I restart a failed workflow execution?
queries.expected_answer: View failed executions in the Dead Letter Queue, inspect the execution context and error details, and use the 'Retry' button to reprocess with the same input data

queries.query: What are the recommended steps for troubleshooting a workflow failure?
queries.expected_answer: Verify service health, check API connectivity, review recent deployments, inspect platform metrics, check logs, and follow the escalation procedure based on the severity level

queries.query: How do I set up database connection pooling in CloudFlow?
queries.expected_answer: Use PgBouncer for connection pooling, configure CloudFlow to use PgBouncer, set connection pool modes, and add read replicas to optimize database performance

queries.query: What Kubernetes resources are needed to deploy CloudFlow?
queries.expected_answer: Deploy an EKS cluster with managed node groups, configure storage with EBS CSI driver, set up a namespace with resource quotas, and use Helm charts for deployment
